page.title: 09Erisey Manor Farm
page.content: Three kilometres north of Ruan Minor is an old manor house.It is called Erisey because a very important family called Erisey used to live there in the 13th century.James Erisey was Sheriff of Cornwall in 1512 and 1513.In memory of James Erisey and his wife Margaret there is a brass of them in Grade Church showing that James died in 1522.When Richard Erisey died in 1722 there was no direct male heir in the family so much of the Erisey's valuable furniture in the old manor house was taken away.Now it is a farm used for beef,sheep and corn.At the front are two large pillars dated 1673.Around the door are the letters R and M and the date 1620.There is a barn made from cut serpentine from Poltesco.There are two pillars at the back dated 1671.There is an old garden probably used by the old Eriseys.
